definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to pursue/to be after/to hunt down
to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
to fish for (aquatic animals and plants)/to catch
to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food

sentences.english: REPORER Most of the time, she can be found lobstering with her dad working in the stern.
sentences.chinese: 記者大多數時間，她都和父親在船上捕龍蝦。

sentences.english: As a kid, he burned off energy outdoors catching snakes and turtles.
sentences.chinese: 孩童時期，他就愛在野外撒歡，抓蛇，捕烏龜。

sentences.english: Circling the traps, he positions himself in between his son and the bear trap.
sentences.chinese: 他繞過那些陷阱，用自己的身體把兒子和捕熊器隔開。

sentences.english: This bear had been fishing in the river on this morning. It climbed onto the bank and laid down in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 在河裏捕了一早的魚，棕熊爬到岸邊臥在草地上。

sentences.english: The city is highly industrialized and has a large shrimp-fishing fleet. Population, 257, 453.
sentences.chinese: 此市具有高度工業化並擁有一支巨大的捕蝦隊。

sentences.english: Most of the , she can be found lobstering with her dad working in the stern.
sentences.chinese: 記者大多數，她都和父親在船上捕龍蝦。

sentences.english: The new law has capped the crabbing season in our area.
sentences.chinese: 新法律限制了該地區捕螃的時節。

sentences.english: The farmers will not be satisfied till all the local foxes have been hunted down.
sentences.chinese: 直到把當地的狐狸都捕盡殺絕，這些農民們纔會滿意。

sentences.english: They caught more fish than I had expected (that they would catch) .
sentences.chinese: 他們捕的魚比我預料的要多。

sentences.english: No hunting has been here for a long time. Therefore, the pheasants are not afraid of people.
sentences.chinese: 由於長期不受捕打，這裏的白馬雞沒有對人類的恐懼。

sentences.english: Glow sticks are used as lures for catching swordfish.
sentences.chinese: 熒光棒可以用於捕抓劍魚的誘餌。

sentences.english: Filling 20 bags with fish made the people cheerful and optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 整整捕了二十袋魚，這讓漁民們很高興興奮。

sentences.english: He brought a ship and tried to shrimp on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 他買了一條船並試著在海上捕蝦子。

sentences.english: They go fishing about twice a week and they always go to the People's Park.
sentences.chinese: 他們每週都去捕兩次魚，他們經常還去人民公園。

definition: to lure into a trap/to trap/to capture
to implicate/net for birds or fish
bailiff responsible for catching criminals (in imperial China)
to track down/to investigate and arrest
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle
